clinical_study.official_title: A Resident-initiated, Step-wise, Competency-based, Graduated Operative Curriculum to Enhance Resident Autonomy for Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to implement and evaluate the need, feasibility and effectiveness of a resident-initiated, step-wise, graduated operative curriculum designed to enhance resident autonomy for laparoscopic cholecystectomy for general surgery residents.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this study is to improve resident autonomy and confidence through detailed and stepwise feedback and to also assess resident and attending perceptions regarding resident skill and autonomy.

primary_outcome.description: Measured using a validated Zwisch based survey to compare the rate of progression of surgical resident autonomy performing laparoscopic cholecystectomy pre and post implementation of standardized step-wise operative curriculum

primary_outcome.measure: Change is Surgical Resident's Operative Skills
primary_outcome.description: Measured using a validated Zwisch based survey to compare the rate of progression of surgical resident operative skills performing laparoscopic cholecystectomy pre and post implementation of standardized step-wise operative curriculum

Measured using a validated Zwisch based survey to compare the rate of progression of surgical resident reported confidence performing laparoscopic cholecystectomy pre and post implementation of standardized step-wise operative curriculum

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Surgical Resident and Attending Physician Perceptions
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between surgical resident and attending physician's perceptions of progression of resident operative skills performing laparoscopic cholecystectomy pre and post implementation of standardized step-wise operative curriculum using a validated Zwisch based survey.

arm_group.description: General surgery residents at Mayo Clinic will complete surveys measuring resident autonomy, performance, confidence and case complexity at baseline and postoperatively following laparoscopic cholecystectomy to serve as a pre-intervention baseline. A standardized step-wise operative curriculum will then be implemented Residents will follow and graduate through this curriculum by initiating a perioperative model of briefing objectives, intraoperative teaching, and debriefing feedback (BID). The effectiveness of the intervention will then be measured by comparing survey results pre and post intervention.

intervention.intervention_name: briefing objectives, intraoperative teaching, and debriefing feedback
intervention.description: A standardized step-wise operative curriculum amongst general surgeons will be implemented among all general surgery residents. Residents will follow and graduate through this curriculum by initiating a perioperative model of briefing objectives, intraoperative teaching, and debriefing feedback (BID).
